intro: Cephalopanax pachycephalus, commonly known as the thick-headed aralia, is a flowering plant native to the forests of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by dark blue berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
